docs.snippet: The 26th Paris Biennale des Antiquaires opened its doors at the Grand Palais on Friday, revealing where the greatest in art remains available for sale....

headline.print_headline: Learning Again to Savor Sweet Wine
headline.main: Learning Again to Savor Sweet Wine

docs.snippet: Dry wines so dominate the market that many people have forgotten the joys and subtleties of sweet wines like those grown in the Roussillon region of France....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dry wines so dominate the market that many people have forgotten the joys and subtleties of sweet wines like those grown in the Roussillon region of France.

headline.print_headline: Royals Sue Over Photos Of Duchess, Top Bared
headline.seo: Photos of Topless Kate Middleton Prompt Lawsuit
headline.main: Royal Couple Sue Over Photos of Topless Duchess

docs.snippet: Britain’s royal household rebuked a French magazine for photographs of the former Kate Middleton topless, evoking the furor around press coverage of Diana....
docs.abstract: British Royal family is suing French magazine Closer for invasion of privacy after publishing paparazzi photographs of the Duchess of Cambridge, the former Kate Middleton, sunbathing topless at a secluded villa in Provence.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and JOHN F. BURNS

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain’s royal household rebuked a French magazine for photographs of the former Kate Middleton topless, evoking the furor around press coverage of Diana.

headline.print_headline: Fed Action Keeps Rally Going for a 4th Day
headline.main: Fed Action Keeps Rally Going for a 4th Day

docs.snippet: Shares on Wall Street closed higher a day after the Federal Reserve gave a green light to big asset purchases to boost the American economy....
docs.abstract: Stock indexes rise for a fourth consecutive session, closing out the week at nearly five-year highs after the Federal Reserve took bold action to spur the economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Shares on Wall Street closed higher a day after the Federal Reserve gave a green light to big asset purchases to boost the American economy.

headline.print_headline: Benedict Takes Message Of Tolerance to Lebanon
headline.seo: Pope Takes Message of Tolerance to Lebanon
headline.main: Benedict Takes Message of Tolerance to Lebanon

docs.snippet: Pope Benedict XVI traveled to Lebanon with a message that took on wider resonance as anti-American protests spread to some 20 countries....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Pope Benedict XVI travels to Lebanon with a message of tolerance that takes on wider resonance as anti-American protests over anit-Islam video spreads to some 20 countries; Benedict calls for an end to violence in Syria, even as protesters 50 miles away attack American restaurant chain in Tripoli.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and RACHEL DONADIO
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Beirut, and Rachel Donadio from Rome and Vatican City. Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Benedict XVI traveled to Lebanon with a message that took on wider resonance as anti-American protests spread to some 20 countries.

headline.print_headline: Spain’s Struggling Economy Tops Agenda at Meeting of European Finance Ministers
headline.seo: France and Germany at Odds Over Aiding Spain’s Economy
headline.main: France and Germany at Odds Over Aiding Spain’s Economy

docs.snippet: Ministers indicated at the start of a two-day meeting that recent decisions had provided breathing room to find longer-term solutions to the debt crisis....
docs.abstract: Split emerges between France and Germany over the urgency of supporting the ailing Spanish economy and the scope of banking regulation for euro nations; discord threatens to subdue a rare period of optimism in the region’s three-year debt crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ministers indicated at the start of a two-day meeting that recent decisions had provided breathing room to find longer-term solutions to the debt crisis.

headline.print_headline: Anti-American Protests Flare Beyond the Mideast
headline.seo: Anti-American Protests Over Film Expand to Nearly 20 Countries
headline.main: Anti-American Protests Flare Beyond the Mideast

docs.snippet: Anti-American rage that began over a video insult to Islam spread to nearly 20 countries in the Middle East and beyond....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Anti-American rage that began over a video insult to Islam spreads to nearly 20 countries across the Middle East and beyond; proliferation of violent and sometimes deadly protests have convulsed the birthplaces of the Arab Spring revolutions, breached two more United States Embassies and targeted diplomatic properties of Germany and Britain.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo; Alan Cowell from London; Monica Marks from Tunis; Nasser Arrabyee from Sana, Yemen; Tim Arango from Baghdad; Nicholas Kulish from Berlin; Steven Lee Myers from Washington; Alissa J. Rubin from Kabul, Afghanistan; Kareem Fahim from Beirut, Lebanon; Fares Akram from Gaza; Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem; and Christine Hauser from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anti-American rage that began over a video insult to Islam spread to nearly 20 countries in the Middle East and beyond.

headline.main: Chinese Ships Enter Japanese-Controlled Waters to Protest Sale of Islands

docs.snippet: It was the first such move by China since Japan announced that it had bought a group of disputed islands in the East China Sea....

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was the first such move by China since Japan announced that it had bought a group of disputed islands in the East China Sea.

headline.print_headline: China: Trial Date Set for Figure Linked to a Political Scandal
headline.seo: Wang Lijun, Chinese Official, to Go on Trial Tuesday
headline.main: China Sets Trial Date for Figure in Scandal

docs.snippet: Wang Lijun, the charismatic police chief under the fallen politician Bo Xilai, will be tried on Tuesday in the southwestern city of Chengdu, according to a court official....
docs.abstract: Trial date for is set for Wang Lijun, former police chief in Chongqing, China, under the fallen politician Bo Xilai; Wang faces charges of defection, illegal surveillance and taking bribes.
docs.lead_paragraph: Wang Lijun, the charismatic police chief under the fallen politician Bo Xilai, will be tried on Tuesday in the southwestern city of Chengdu, according to a court official.
